current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend titles 5 and 28, United States Code, to require annual reports to Congress on, and the
			 maintenance of databases on, awards of fees and other expenses to
			 prevailing parties in certain administrative proceedings and court cases
			 to which the United States is a party, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Modification of equal access to justice provisions

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended—

text.#text: in subsection (c)(1), by striking
by redesignating subsection (f) as subsection (i); and
by striking subsection (e) and inserting the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act

in evaluating the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Congress

text.#text:
Each report under paragraph (1) shall describe the number, nature,
			 and amount of the awards, the claims involved in the controversy, and any
			 other relevant information that may aid

Each report under paragraph (1) shall account for all payments of fees and other expenses
			 awarded under this section that are made pursuant to a settlement
			 agreement, regardless of whether the settlement agreement is sealed or
			 otherwise subject to nondisclosure provisions.

The disclosure of fees and other expenses required under subparagraph (A) shall not affect any
			 other
			 information that is subject to a nondisclosure provision in a settlement
			 agreement.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall create and maintain a
			 searchable
			 database on an Internet Web site containing the following information with
			 respect to each award
			 of fees and other expenses under this section made on or after the date of
			 enactment of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chairman of the
			 Administrative Conference of the United States
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Administrative Conference of the United States

text.#text:
As soon as practicable, and in any event not later than the date on which the first report under
			 subsection (e)(1) is required to be submitted, the

The case name and number of the adversary adjudication, if available, hyperlinked to the case (if
			 available) in any case in which the party other than the agency is not an
			 individual.
The name of the agency involved in the adversary adjudication.
A description of the claims in the adversary adjudication.

For an award made to an individual, a statement indicating that the award was made to an individual
			 that shall not include any personally identifiable information.
For an award made to a party other than an individual, the name of the party.
The amount of the award.

The basis for the finding that the position of the agency concerned was not substantially
			 justified.

The searchable database described in subsection (f) may not reveal any information the
			 disclosure of which is prohibited by law or a court order.

in a timely
			 manner all information requested by the

to comply with the

Each report under subparagraph (A) shall account for all payments of fees and other expenses

The disclosure of fees and other expenses required under clause (i) shall not affect any other
